title.value: TAAL: Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning in Medical Image Segmentation
title.justification: The title exactly matches the focus of the research, which introduces a new active learning method for medical image segmentation.
title.quote: TAAL: Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning in Medical Image Segmentation

extractions.description: This paper introduces TAAL (Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning), a novel semi-supervised active learning approach tailored for medical image segmentation. The method leverages cross-augmentation consistency to enhance model learning and optimize sample selection for annotation based on uncertainty measures from data transformations. The approach aims to improve performance in both fully-supervised and semi-supervised settings without relying on external modules or simple heuristics.

type.justification: The paper proposes a novel theoretical framework and method for active learning in medical image segmentation, rather than providing empirical results alone.
type.quote: This paper proposes Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning (TAAL), a novel semi-supervised active learning approach for segmentation

primary_research_field.justification: The research focuses on enhancing deep learning methods for medical image segmentation through active learning techniques.
primary_research_field.quote: Deep learning methods typically depend on the availability of labeled data, which is expensive and time-consuming to obtain.

sub_research_fields.justification: The core application domain of the proposed method is medical image segmentation.
sub_research_fields.quote: While frameworks for active learning have been widely explored in the context of classification of natural images, they have been only sparsely used in medical image segmentation.

name.justification: The U-Net architecture is explicitly used as the backbone for the segmentation model in the experiments.
name.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

caracteristics.justification: U-Net is a type of CNN specially designed for medical image segmentation tasks.
caracteristics.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

name.justification: The ACDC dataset is used for evaluating the proposed method on cardiac MRI scans.
name.quote: Dataset The publicly available ACDC dataset [26] comprises cardiac 3D cine-MRI scans from 100 patients.

name.justification: The experiments and implementation of the proposed method are carried out using the PyTorch framework.
name.quote: We implemented the methods using the PyTorch framework.
